Node.definition: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= causative action by which someone in authority confers the office of priest, king, or prophet on another person, by pouring oil on that person's head
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

= state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

Node.gloss: to wrap|to bandage|to tie|to bind up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans wrap something around an inanimate object
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= a person or group that has been forcibly carried off into slavery or exile

= state of being free from control and not in the power of someone else, which is not restricted to slavery and captivity only, but includes financial debts; it also applies to farm land that is free from being enslaved by the farmer and is allowed to lay fallow; it also applies to inalienable possessions, such as land, which is released to return to its rightful owner
= to be held by someone else, either in a prison or in another situation in which one does not have the freedom to act and go at will; ≈ usually regarded as hardship
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= head dress; ◄ made out of cloth; ► worn by priests, but also by ordinary men and women, probably on special occasions; not to be worn when in mourning; ≈ therefore associated with joy

= powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: a weakened spirit; hence: = state in which humans have lost courage
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon

= tree, more commonly known as אֵלָה (אֵלָה) with a broad crown, heavy branches, and thick trunk; may reach a height of 7.5 to 9 m.; sheds its leaves; has small an inconspicuous flowers; ◄ pictacia terebinthus; ► its stem contains aromatic turpentine, a resinous juice, which flows out when the bark is cut; it provides pleasant shade; ≈ imposing tree, preferred place to sit under and enjoy the shade, associated with cultic worship

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of honor and respect more than others
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= causative action by which humans restore an object to make it function again in the way it has functioned before

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which a land or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= person associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own
= person practicing agriculture as his profession
= farmer specialized in growing grapes
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to eat > to enjoy|to eat > to use up
Node.definition: literally: to eat (goods); hence = pattern of actions by which someone makes a living off material goods until they are gone; ≈ often associated with joy
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
= action by which humans utter words about themselves, usually with the purpose of drawing all attention to themselves
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans or deities show a favorable attitude to (other) humans
= group of people that consider themselves descendants of one single ancestor

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to clothe (someone with a certain state)
Node.definition: literally: to clothe; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans or animals to attain a certain quality or status
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

= long garment, hanging down to the ankles, ◄ usually made of wool, ► and worn over the tunic (כֻּתֹּנֶת) it is not clear whether it had sleeves or not, nor whether it was open or closed in the front; ≈ certain attitudes and emotions are often described in terms of such a garment, e.g. he wore fury like a robe

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= causative action by which deities cover humans with clothing
= man who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy
meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which humans mimick a priest by dressing up in a certain way
= head dress; ◄ made out of cloth; ► worn by priests, but also by ordinary men and women, probably on special occasions; not to be worn when in mourning; ≈ therefore associated with joy
= woman who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to bring out; = causative process by which deities cause land, or objects to produce flowers or crops

= process by which new growth comes up, either springing from the ground or from part of an existing plant, and starts growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming into existence of people, conditions, or activities
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance
= plants that are coming up after having been sown in a plot of land

Node.gloss: to cause to sprout|to make come up|to cause to bring forth
Node.definition: = causative process by which a deity or the earth causes plants or horns to come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to cause to sprout|to make come up|to cause to bring forth
Node.definition: = causative process by which a deity or the earth causes plants or horns to come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
